name: framer-syntax
description: A color theme inspired by the Framer Editor with Bracket Pair Colorizer 2 integrated.

bracket-pair-colorizer-2.forceUniqueOpen.description: Ensure that an opening brackets color does not match a previous brackets color

bracket-pair-colorizer-2.forceIterationC.description: Should opening brackets iterate the color cycle even if they are not nested

bracket-pair-colorizer-2.colorMode.description: Should different brackets share a color group (Consecutive), or use their own color group (Independent)

bracket-pair-colorizer-2.highlightActive.description: Should the active scope brackets always be highlighted? Recommended to disable editor.matchBrackets if using this feature.

bracket-pair-colorizer-2.activeScopeCSS.description: CSS for the active scope. Use {color} to match the bracket color. The string types listed at https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/extensionAPI/vscode-api#DecorationRenderOptions can be used

bracket-pair-colorizer-2.showBracketsInG.description: Show active bracket scope in gutter?

bracket-pair-colorizer-2.showBracketsInR.description: Show active bracket scope in ruler?

bracket-pair-colorizer-2.rulerPosition.description: Show active bracket scope in ruler?

bracket-pair-colorizer-2.showVerticalSco.description: Show a vertical line on the left side of the editor representing the active bracket scope?

bracket-pair-colorizer-2.showHorizontalS.description: Show a horizontal line to create a block around the active bracket scope?

bracket-pair-colorizer-2.scopeLineRelati.description: True: Scope Line will start from the ending bracket position. False: Scope Line will always be at column 0

bracket-pair-colorizer-2.scopeLineCSS.description: CSS for the scope line. Use {color} to match the bracket color. The string types listed at https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/extensionAPI/vscode-api#DecorationRenderOptions can be used

bracket-pair-colorizer-2.excludedLanguag.description: Don't colorize files of these languages
